intro: Afrothismia winkleri var. winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's afrothismia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
